channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Santa is coming to Wall Street early this season, and analysts say 2026 is shaping up to be another big year of gains
item.description: Deutsche Bank predicted the S&P 500 will finish next year at 8,000, representing a 17% jump from Friday's close.

item.title: Want to save money on an Apple iPhone this holiday season? Try these 3 shopping hacks
item.description: Thanksgiving is behind us, which means the holiday shopping season has officially begun. And that means that both companies and third-party retailers ...

item.title: The Billion-Dollar AI Startup Rejecting 996 Hustle Culture
item.description: Karri Saarinen, CEO of Linear, which makes software to streamline product development and has a $1.25 billion valuation, tells Fast Company why he’s b...

item.title: Northwestern will pay Trump admin $75 million to settle antisemitism cases and restore funding while agreeing to ‘socialize international students’
item.description: The Trump administration had frozen $790 million in grants that contributed to university layoffs and the resignation of the university's president in...

item.title: Despite their ‘no limits’ friendship, Russia is paying a nearly 90% markup on sanctioned goods from China — compared to 9% from other countries
item.description: While the value of Chinese ball-bearing exports to Russia jumped by 76% from 2021 to 2024, the quantity of exports actually dropped by 13%.

item.title: Brown grass caused the PGA Tour to pull out of a historic Maui golf course, leaving a $50 million hole for the island reeling from drought, wildfires
item.description: West Maui is facing drought and still reeling from its 2023 wildfire.

item.title: What You Don’t Know About Your Business Could Cost You
item.description: The problem is not bad leadership. It is an information gap.

item.title: The ChatGPT effect: How AI changed the way people search for things
item.description: Three years ago, if someone needed to fix a leaky faucet or understand inflation, they usually did one of three things: typed the question into Google...

item.title: Even the Pope couldn’t avoid the Airbus software fix that disrupted flights across the world
item.description: An analysis found computer code that may have contributed to a sudden drop in the altitude of a JetBlue plane last month.

item.title: How SailGP turned the niche sport into a $200 million celebrity investment magnet
item.description: This summer, Ryan Reynolds and Hugh Jackman became co-owners of Australia’s three-time champion SailGP team. Days earlier, Anne Hathaway joined a fema...

item.title: The danger of believing business myths
item.description: There’s an old myth that Inuit cultures have as many as a hundred words for snow. I remember learning about it in school, and there was just something...

item.title: Prioritizing Daily Self-Care Just Might Be the Key to Greater Impact in Business
item.description: If you only view self-care as something that happens when the workday is over, you’re missing out.

item.title: 5 Bad Habits That Make You Look Unprofessional at Work
item.description: Consider putting a stop to them ASAP.

item.title: The 3-Question Formula for Better Team Meetings
item.description: Most leaders don’t need more meetings, they need better ones.

item.title: How the Trump administration’s ‘efficiency’ goals have exacerbated food waste
item.description: The U.S. government has caused massive food waste during President Donald Trump’s second term. Policies such as immigration raids, tariff changes, and...
